section.title: Subscribing to the oVirt Engine Channels using Subscription Manager

step.para: Run the subscription-manager register command to register the system with the Red Hat Network. To complete registration successfully you will need to supply your Red Hat Network Username and Password when prompted.

step.title: Identify Available Entitlement Pools
step.para: To subscribe the system to oVirt you must locate the identifiers for the relevant entitlement pools. Use the list action of the subscription-manager to find these.

To identify available subscription pools for JBoss Enterprise Application Platform use the command:
step.screen: # subscription-manager list --available | grep -A8 "JBoss Enterprise Application Platform"

note.para: Beta releases of oVirt Engine are distributed using an alternative channel. Beta releases consist of pre-release software. They must not be used in a production environment. The entitlement required to obtain beta releases of oVirt Engine is called oVirt Beta.

step.title: Subscribe System to Entitlement Pools
step.para: Using the pool identifiers located in the previous step, subscribe the system to Fedora Server, oVirt, and JBoss Application Platform entitlements. Use the subscribe parameter to the subscription-manager command, replacing POOLID with one of the pool identifiers each time the command is run.:

section.para: The system is now registered with Red Hat Network and subscribed to the channels required for oVirt Engine installation.
